title: Confidence interval for proportion of male births

content.description: Jessica wanted to determine if the proportion of males for a certain species of laboratory animal is less than 0.5. She was given access to appropriate records that contained information on 12,000 live births for the species. To construct a 95 percent confidence interval, she selected a simple random sample of 100 births from the records and found that 31 births were male.
content.question: Based on the study, which of the following expressions is an approximate 95 percent confidence interval estimate for p, the proportion of males in the 12,000 live births?

choices.label: 0.31 plus or minus 1.96 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.31 times 0.69 and denominator 12,000
0.31 plus or minus 1.645 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.31 times 0.69 and denominator 12,000
0.31 plus or minus 1.96 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.5 times 0.5 and denominator 12,000
0.31 plus or minus 1.645 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.5 times 0.5 and denominator 100
0.31 plus or minus 1.96 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.31 times 0.69 and denominator 100

content.answer: 0.31 plus or minus 1.96 times the square root of the fraction with numerator 0.31 times 0.69 and denominator 100

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
